content: बाल {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Young, infantine, not full-grown or developed (of persons or things); बालेन स्थविरेण वा <ls>Ms. 8. 70</ls>; बालाशोकमुपोढरागसुभगं भेदोन्मुखं तिष्ठति <ls>V. 2. 7</ls>; so बालमंदारवृक्षः <ls>Me. 75</ls>; <ls>R. 2. 45</ls>; <ls n="R.">13. 24.</ls> {@--2@} Newly risen, young (as the sun or its rays); <ls>R. 12. 100.</ls> {@--3@} New, waxing (as the moon); पुषोष वृद्धिं हरिदश्वदीधितेरनुप्रवेशादिव बालचंद्रमाः <ls>R. 3. 22</ls>; <ls>Ku. 3. 29.</ls> {@--4@} Puerile {@--5@} Ignorant, unwise. {@--6@} Pure (as an animal fit for sacrifice). --लः {@--1@} A child, an infant; बालादपि सुभाषितं (ग्राह्यं); <ls>Ms. 2. 239.</ls> {@--2@} A boy, youth, young person. {@--3@} A minor (under 16 years of age); बाल आषोडशाद्वर्षात् <ls>Nārada</ls>. {@--4@} A colt, foal. {@--5@} A fool, simpleton; <ls>Pt. 4. 91.</ls> {@--6@} ({%a%}) A tail. ({%b%}) An elephant's or a horse's tail. {@--7@} Hair; <ls>Ku. 1. 48.</ls> {@--8@} An elephant five years old. {@--9@} A kind of perfume. {@--10@} The cocoa-nut.
